alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 1:55PM EDT until May 02 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Franklin, Oxford and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding from small streams and creeks through this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 152 PM EDT, Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Even though the rain is moving out, there will be continued flooding caused by high flowing streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Rangeley, Rumford, Kingfield, Bingham, Andover, Carrabassett Valley, Errol, Phillips and Weld.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
